About the job
Overview

Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential‚Äîand excitement for the journey ahead.

As a Data Scientist Intern at Microsoft, you will use machine learning, statistics, experiments, and more to build and improve great products while making business impact. As a Data Scientist intern you will collaborate with stakeholders, formulate approaches to solve problems and use algorithms and data sources in the context of business and engineering needs. You will also be able to combine your engineering abilities with analytical skills to make customer experiences better. Our Data Scientists use innovative methods, algorithms and tools daily to drive results throughout Microsoft devices, operating systems, products, and services and provide novel insights into business and customer scenarios.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You‚Äôll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Formulate approaches to solve problems using well defined algorithms and data sources
Incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems.
Use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data.
Interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.
Engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers.
Participate in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.

Qualifications

Currently pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field.
Must have at least one additional quarter/semester of school remaining following the completion of the internship

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion
At Microsoft, we strive to create an environment where people with different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives thrive. Our journey and our learnings are ongoing, but we are clear about our goals: We want every employee to feel like we can be our authentic selves, in alignment with our company values, so we can do our best work. We‚Äôre focused on increasing representation, from interns all the way through to the boardroom. Our accountability starts at the highest levels of our organization and extends to every role. We aim to influence systemic and‚ÄØsustainable change, which requires us to do the micro and macro motions every single day that impact employees‚Äô experiences and transform the systems that drive access, opportunity, and greater equality. We know that interests can shift and careers evolve over time. That‚Äôs why Microsoft is committed to helping our employees discover their passions, grow the skills they need to realize them, and connect with people who can support them throughout their career. We support our employees‚Äô development by focusing on three pillars of the career experience: discovery, connection, and growth. If they‚Äôre looking for inspiration, we provide resources that can help them discover new interests and engage with them in meaningful ways. We connect employees with the One Microsoft community and empower them to make the most of everything Microsoft‚Äôs global network has to offer. And we have an entire ecosystem of learning opportunities and experiences designed to help our employees grow professionally and personally.

About the job
Data Scientist Intern

Role Description
SkillzenLoop is looking for an intellectually curious Data Scientist Intern to help us extract value from our data. In this role, you will go beyond simple analysis to build predictive models, design experiments, and apply advanced statistical techniques to solve complex business problems. Primary Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Statistical Modeling: Apply various statistical and machine learning techniques to identify trends and build predictive prototypes.
‚Ä¢ Data Wrangling: Clean and integrate large, complex datasets from multiple sources to prepare them for modeling.
‚Ä¢ Algorithm Development: Assist in developing and testing custom algorithms to improve product features and user experience.
‚Ä¢ Insight Communication: Interpret and communicate data insights to stakeholders through compelling storytelling and advanced visualization.
‚Ä¢ Experimental Design: Assist in designing and analyzing A/B tests to measure the impact of new features or business strategies.
Requirements
‚Ä¢ Education: Currently pursuing or a recent graduate of a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field (Bachelors with strong projects also considered).

About the job
Achieving our goals starts with supporting yours. Grow your career, access top-tier health and wellness benefits, build lasting connections with your team and our customers, and travel the world using our extensive route network.

Come join us to create what‚Äôs next. Let‚Äôs define tomorrow, together.

Description

United's Digital Technology team designs, develops, and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.

Job Overview And Responsibilities

The Analytics and Innovation (Ai) team at United Airlines works to innovate, transform, and solve complex business problems resulting in significant and measurable enterprise impact through the application of deep cross-functional business expertise and advanced analytics. We work with business and technology partners across the enterprise (e.g. Airport Operations, Contact Centers, Network Planning, Revenue Management, Digital Products, Human Resources, etc.) to influence strategic decisions, enterprise strategy, business process, and to help connect the dots across the enterprise. We aim to be an organization with whom and within everyone loves to work!

Data Scientists within Ai partner with business and technology leaders across the company to deploy AI & ML powered solutions to support and automate business processes. The team works closely with other teams in digital technology with complementing skills and capabilities. The key objectives are to drive incremental revenue, boost customer engagement and to automate manual processes by leveraging state-of-the-art ML techniques. Data Scientists contribute to developing smart and innovative solutions across many of United‚Äôs departments.

Work with other data scientists and a variety of stakeholders (IT, DE, business etc.) to deliver high-quality models
Gathering and analyzing data of United‚Äôs various operations to make fact-based, data-driven recommendations
Execute solutions to business problems using data analysis, machine learning and optimization tools 
Enable data transfer between platforms and monitor model performance for scalable project deployments
Research latest machine learning approaches and share the knowledge across the team
Effectively structure communication of insights from work streams and deliver clear and professional presentations to the team/team leaders/managers
Partner and engage with data engineering and operations teams to inform and support business stakeholders with day-to-day project updates.

This position is offered on local terms and conditions. Expatriate assignments and sponsorship for employment visas, even on a time-limited visa status, will not be awarded. This position is for United Airlines Business Services Pvt. Ltd - a wholly owned subsidiary of United Airlines Inc.

Qualifications

What‚Äôs needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):

Bachelor‚Äôs degree 
Engineering, Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Economics
0 ‚Äì 3 years experience
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
 Proficiency in Programming Languages (Python/R), SQL, Excel and other Microsoft Office products
 Intermediate knowledge in machine learning algorithms like Bagging (Decision Trees, RF), Boosting (XGBoost, GBM) , Clustering (KMeans)
 Proven comfort and an intellectual curiosity for working with very large sets of data
 Understanding of probability & statistics
 Ability to bridge business context with technical details and explain and discuss mathematical and machine learning technicalities to a business audience
 Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on teamwork

Artificial Intelligence Intern

SkillzenLoop is looking for a brilliant and forward-thinking Artificial Intelligence Intern to join our innovation lab. In this role, you will go beyond traditional programming to work on Generative AI, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Computer Vision projects. You will help us explore how AI can be integrated into our core products to create smarter, more intuitive user experiences.
Primary Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Model Implementation: Assist in the development and fine-tuning of AI models using frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras.
‚Ä¢ LLM Exploration: Work with Large Language Models (LLMs) and explore prompt engineering and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) architectures.
‚Ä¢ Data Engineering: Collaborate on building data pipelines that feed into AI training environments, ensuring high-quality data inputs.

‚Ä¢ AI Fundamentals: Solid understanding of Neural Networks, Deep Learning, and Transformers.

About the job
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.




Job Description

The Client Services Data & AI Solutions Team builds open, trusted data and AI culture where the cost of curiosity is low, and insights are actionable. We govern transactional data and metrics, deliver usable dashboards and certified data sources, and apply analytics and AI to generate value. We partner with stakeholders, from executive leaders to customer-facing teams, ensuring data and AI assets are reliable, secure, and embedded in daily work.


In this specialist role, we are seeking a highly skilled AI Engineer to lead the development and integration of AI technologies into our Client Services operations. This role focuses on leveraging generative AI, machine learning operations (MLOps), AI model fine-tuning, enrichment pipelines to enhance service delivery and predictive capabilities.


Responsibilities:


Establish data, AI processes and automation aligned to business and technology requirements, leveraging supported data platforms, MLOps tooling, and models. 
Build production-grade AI services: LLM-based applications, RAG pipelines, recommendation systems, forecasting, and classification
Develop and maintain data models and schemas optimized for analytics, ML feature stores, and AI workloads. 
Deliver data engineering and AI projects end to end: ingestion, modeling, pipeline development, feature engineering, model training, deployment, and monitoring.

Role

We love and value open source software, so this summer, we're sponsoring internships to work on our open source static site generator project Statue, our community/site hosting through statue.dev, and our open source distributed programming project Collector.
